alert.note: Alert for Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and southern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey... Monmouth. In southern New Jersey...Ocean. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 156 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Lakewood, Howell, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Manasquan, Point Pleasant Beach, Farmingdale, Roosevelt, Freewood Acres, and Adelphia. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 11 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 94 and 107. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
